articles.title: Breached dolphin's brains show neuropathology similar to Alzheimer's - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: In a new European Journal of Neuroscience study, scientists studied the brains of Odontocetes (Toothed whales) to document the presence or absence of neuropathological hallmarks of AD.
articles.content: In elderly adults, the most common neurodegenerative disease is Alzheimer's disease (AD). It is also the leading cause of dependency and disability. Besides humans, many other animals have been seen … [+5306 chars]

articles.author: Tessa Koumoundouros
articles.title: A Single Giant Queen 'Murder Hornet' Sparked The Invasion of Europe - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Invasive species have a notorious ability to spread rapidly through unprepared ecosystems, wreaking havoc along their way.
articles.content:
Invasive species have a notorious ability to spread rapidly through unprepared ecosystems, wreaking havoc along their way. 
The Asian hornet (Vespa velutina), is no exception, expanding its habitat … [+2637 chars]

articles.title: Paris shooting suspect expressed 'hatred of foreigners', says prosecutor - Reuters
articles.description: A suspect accused of gunning down three Kurdish people in Paris told investigators of his "hatred of foreigners", the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday.
articles.content:
PARIS, Dec 25 (Reuters) - A suspect accused of gunning down three Kurdish people in Paris told investigators of his "hatred of foreigners", the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday.
